features: UNIVERSAL FIT: Our bottle handles are designed to seamlessly integrate with Avent Anti-Colic Baby Feeding Bottles, accommodating 4oz, 9oz, and 11oz bottles effortlessly.
GENTLE GRIP FOR LITTLE HANDS: Crafted with an ergonomic design tailored for tiny hands, these baby bottle handles facilitate independent drinking, aiding the smooth transition from bottle to cup.
SECURE AND LEAK-PROOF : Featuring a premium seamless inner wall, our handles ensure a non-slip and spill-proof feeding experience for your little one.
100% BABY-FRIENDLY: Crafted from top-tier food-grade PP materials, our bottle handles are free from BPA, phthalates, latex, and lead, guaranteeing a safe and healthy experience for your baby.

USER-FRIENDLY DESIGN: The removable trainer handles are dishwasher and sterilizer safe, making them easy to attach and clean. Please note: This is an aftermarket product produced by ROPOSY Products and is not affiliated with PHILIPS AVENT NATURAL BABY BOTTLE.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These screw on under the nipple for the Philips Avent colic bottles. I tried them on other Philips' bottles, the glass ones and other ones, and they don't fit those, they only fit the plastic colic bottles that have the stem that relieve gas in them. But for those they are excellent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works decently, but my baby prefers no handles
reviews.reviewText: My 8 mo old has been working on feeding themselves with a bottle for a few months now and can often get through a whole bottle without much help (I just need to hand it back if it gets dropped). I thought these handles might make it even easier especially with the claim they could be sterilized and go in the dishwasher with everything else.I've shared five different bottles with the same ring and nipple and the handles attached to each. Then I'm one picture I've shown all five bottles. All five fit the handles, but the three on the left allow the handles to spin and the two on the right do not. I believe the ones without logos are spectra and motif but I'm not sure which is which. I haven't noticed the spinning being an issue though so that's a plus.Whether it spins or not depends on how tightly the ring you have fits the bottle you're putting it on, as the handle simply sits below the bottom of the ring. I was worried when I ordered these that they might cause a leak if they stopped the ring from fully tightening, but that hasn't been an issue with any bottle I've tried. I've included one picture that shows the area of the handles where it sits in the bottle.The handles stick out from the bottles quite a bit which might make them easier to grab but at least for my baby it feels a bit too spread out. They're also sort of a spoon shape which doesn't seem very useful for my baby. I think something more like a cylinder would be an easier shape to grab.In the end, I probably won't keep using these as my baby has progressed significantly in their ability to hold their bottle without handles and I think this would just be another additional skill to learn, but I know for months I was thinking "what if there were handles for bottles like sippy cups have?" so I could see these handles being useful if we had them earlier on - say at 4 or 5 months old when they started feeding themselves, or potentially even at 2 months when they started working on holding the bottle.I don't know anything about the company so it's hard to trust the claims of no BPAs and all the rest without any additional evidence, so for that and the weird handle shape I'm giving 4 stars. Still potentially useful, but not a fit for our particular needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Bottle Handles!
reviews.reviewText: My daughter is getting old enough to start trying to hold bottles on her own, and instead of buying entirely new bottles, these conveniently fit perfectly on the phillips Avent anti Colic bottles! They feel strong and sturdy, and the 4 pack gives us an extra handle as the Avent bottles came in a pack of 3. Seems like just what we needed, works great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It says it works for my bottles but it not does fit or lock onto the lid as it states,my baby can’t hold the handles without it twisting due to it not being a snug fit

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good little handles that fit anti colic bottles well
reviews.reviewText: Got this to fit my baby’s anti colic avent bottles which it does pretty well. The plastic however is a bit stiff.Pros:- Fits the avent anti-colic bottles pretty well- Fairly inexpensive for a set of fourCons:- Fit can be a bit loose at times- Plastic material is pretty hard/stiff, makes me wish these came in a silicone material even if that would have been a bit more expensive

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Baby loves these!
reviews.reviewText: These handles work perfectly with our Phillips anti colic bottles of both sizes: 4 oz and 9 oz. You simply pop them on the top, then screw the bottle lid on over top and voila, the bottle has handles. Our baby is always trying to hold her own bottle, but can't quite hold the bottle itself for longer than a minute without losing her grasp on it. We tried out a handle and she immediately held on and fed herself happily (with our supervision). These are great for strong-willed, independent babies like ours who like to be in control of their own destiny (and their own feedings).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does the Job
reviews.reviewText: These handle attachments fit on our plastic Avent baby bottles. One puts a handle attachment on the bottle before screwing the nipple portion of the bottle onto the bottle itself. The handles are a good size for a baby to hold. The handle attachment doesn't "lock" into place. Rather, it rotates fairly freely around the bottle, but this is not a problem. When the baby is drinking, the baby holds the bottle in place by virtue of sucking on the "nipple", and holds the handle attachment in place by, of course, holding the handles. So, ultimately these handle attachments work very well. No need to be put off by the fact that the handle attachment can rotate a bit when the baby is not using the handles to drink from the bottle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: i have a philips advent for me it didnt fit unfortunately be sure you have the right bottle tops i have ones that are slightly too wide =( but its not the manufacturer fault otherwise this would've been excellent
